main event: A radar operator at Langley AFB, Virginia reported observing a small unidentified object on radar, which was believed to be unusual behavior.
interesting points: The object was approximately 4 feet in diameter and traveled at high speeds, first detected at approximately 40,000 feet and later hovering at around 25,000 feet., The object descended rapidly and disappeared from radar, leaving the radar operator intrigued., Col. Carl M. Neilson stated the object was likely weather radar test equipment, which was disputed by Capt. Macaubin., It was indicated that the sighting could not be connected with any known radar test equipment at Langley or White Sands., There were no witnesses that corroborated the radar operatorsâ€™s sighting from the surrounding area.
